title: Mori-Zwanzig latent space Koopman closure for nonlinear autoencoder. (arXiv:2310.10745v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: The Koopman operator presents an attractive approach to achieve global linearization of nonlinear systems, making it a valuable method for simplifying the understanding of complex dynamics. While data-driven methodologies have exhibited promise in approximating finite Koopman operators, they grapple with various challenges, such as the judicious selection of observables, dimensionality reduction, and the ability to predict complex system behaviours accurately. This study presents a novel approach termed Mori-Zwanzig autoencoder (MZ-AE) to robustly approximate the Koopman operator in low-dimensional spaces. The proposed method leverages a nonlinear autoencoder to extract key observables for approximating a finite invariant Koopman subspace and integrates a non-Markovian correction mechanism using the Mori-Zwanzig formalism. tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为Mori-Zwanzig自编码器（MZ-AE）的新方法，用于在低维空间中稳健地逼近Koopman算子，通过非线性自编码器和Mori-Zwanzig形式主义的集成实现对有限不变Koopman子空间的逼近，从而增强了精确性和准确预测复杂系统行为的能力。
en_tdlr: This study proposes a novel approach called Mori-Zwanzig autoencoder (MZ-AE) to robustly approximate the Koopman operator in low-dimensional spaces by integrating a nonlinear autoencoder and the Mori-Zwanzig formalism, enhancing precision and accurate prediction of complex system behaviors.
